title: Wrongly Jailed UK Man Forced To Pay Rs 1 Crore In 'Bed And Board' Fees
content: Malkinson, who spent 17 years wrongfully imprisoned, will see a deduction of 100,000 pounds (Rs 1,06,88,639) from his compensation.
summary: Malkinson, who spent 17 years wrongfully imprisoned, will see a deduction of 100,000 pounds (Rs 1,06,88,639) from his compensation.

title: King Charles III Ends Silence On UK Far-Right Riots, Praises Police Efforts
content: King Charles III made his first comments on Friday about riots that have shaken British cities, praising the work of police in countering the violence.
summary: King Charles III made his first comments on Friday about riots that have shaken British cities, praising the work of police in countering the violence.

title: "Saw The Plane Spinning": Eyewitness Describes Crash Horror In Brazil
content: An airplane with 57 passengers and four crew members on board crashed in Brazil's Sao Paulo, killing everyone on board. Images and videos from the spot show that the crash left flaming wreckage in a residential neighborhood.
summary: An airplane with 57 passengers and four crew members on board crashed in Brazil's Sao Paulo, killing everyone on board. Images and videos from the spot show that the crash left flaming wreckage in a residential neighborhood.

title: Russia Deploys More Troops, Arms Amid Ukraine Incursion
content: Russia on Friday deployed more troops and munitions to a border region where Ukraine has mounted a major ground offensive, the defence ministry said.
summary: Russia on Friday deployed more troops and munitions to a border region where Ukraine has mounted a major ground offensive, the defence ministry said.

title: Donald Trump's Plane Diverted Due To Technical Snag Ahead Of Montana Rally
content: Former US President Donald Trump's plane was diverted on Friday (local time) to Billings, due to a mechanical issue, CBS News reported citing airport officials.
summary: Former US President Donald Trump's plane was diverted on Friday (local time) to Billings, due to a mechanical issue, CBS News reported citing airport officials.

title: Airstrike On Gaza School Kills 100, Israel Says It Was Hamas Command Centre
content: Gaza's civil defence agency said Saturday an Israeli strike hit a school in Gaza City, killing 90-100 people, while the Israeli military said it had struck a Hamas command centre.
summary: Gaza's civil defence agency said Saturday an Israeli strike hit a school in Gaza City, killing 90-100 people, while the Israeli military said it had struck a Hamas command centre.

title: Inquest To Look Into UK Girl Who Died After Drinking Costa Hot Chocolate
content: Despite her mother's request for soya milk due to Hannah's dairy intolerance, the drink contained regular milk. Hannah, who had multiple food allergies, experienced severe distress and passed away after emergency treatment failed.
summary: Despite her mother's request for soya milk due to Hannah's dairy intolerance, the drink contained regular milk. Hannah, who had multiple food allergies, experienced severe distress and passed away after emergency treatment failed.

title: "Most Violent" Pro-Trump US Capitol Rioter Handed 20-Year Jail Sentence
content: A man described by prosecutors as one of the "most violent" members of a pro-Donald Trump mob that stormed the US Capitol on January 6, 2021, was sentenced to 20 years in prison on Friday.
summary: A man described by prosecutors as one of the "most violent" members of a pro-Donald Trump mob that stormed the US Capitol on January 6, 2021, was sentenced to 20 years in prison on Friday.

title: In Iran, New President vs Revolutionary Guards Over Israel Air Strikes
content: A standoff between Iran's newly elected President Masoud Pezeshkian and some hardliners in the powerful Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) has put the future of Iran's response to Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh's assassination hanging in balance.
summary: A standoff between Iran's newly elected President Masoud Pezeshkian and some hardliners in the powerful Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) has put the future of Iran's response to Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh's assassination hanging in balance.

title: US Confirms Sharing Intel To Prevent Attack At Taylor Swift's Vienna Concert
content: The United States provided intelligence to Austria that helped disrupt an alleged Islamic State plot to attack a Taylor Swift concert, the White House confirmed Friday.
summary: The United States provided intelligence to Austria that helped disrupt an alleged Islamic State plot to attack a Taylor Swift concert, the White House confirmed Friday.

title: Covid-19 Cases Rising Again: WHO Issues Urgent Alert On Severe Variants
content: The World Health Organization (WHO) warns that Covid-19 is making a comeback, with positive test rates increasing across 84 countries and the potential for more severe variants emerging.
summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) warns that Covid-19 is making a comeback, with positive test rates increasing across 84 countries and the potential for more severe variants emerging.

title: Israeli Port Braces For Bombardment Amid Fears Of Iran, Hezbollah Attacks
content: Haifa's residents gaze warily onto the sprawling industrial port that flanks their Israeli city, knowing the potential for a major blast as they brace for bombardment from Hezbollah.
summary: Haifa's residents gaze warily onto the sprawling industrial port that flanks their Israeli city, knowing the potential for a major blast as they brace for bombardment from Hezbollah.

title: Mexican Druglord's Son Surrendered Voluntarily To US, Partner Was Kidnapped
content: The US embassy in Mexico said on Friday that Joaquin Guzman Lopez, the son of the infamous cartel kingpin "El Chapo," had surrendered voluntarily while his father's former partner Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada seemed to have been taken against his will.
summary: The US embassy in Mexico said on Friday that Joaquin Guzman Lopez, the son of the infamous cartel kingpin "El Chapo," had surrendered voluntarily while his father's former partner Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada seemed to have been taken against his will.

title: Imane Khelif: Boxer In Gender Row And Now Olympic Champion
content: Born in a poor village, Algerian boxer Imane Khelif has overcome numerous obstacles throughout her life to win a controversial Paris Olympics gold on Friday.
summary: Born in a poor village, Algerian boxer Imane Khelif has overcome numerous obstacles throughout her life to win a controversial Paris Olympics gold on Friday.

title: Swimmer Who Was Kicked Out Of Olympic Village Wanted To Represent US
content: Paraguayan swimmer Luana Alonso who made headlines for her controversial departure from the Olympic Village wants to compete for the United States instead of her home country, a report said.
summary: Paraguayan swimmer Luana Alonso who made headlines for her controversial departure from the Olympic Village wants to compete for the United States instead of her home country, a report said.

title: Sheikh Hasina's Son Strongly Opposes Interim Government In Bangladesh
content: Sajeeb Wazed Joy, son of former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, has claimed that the recent protests in Bangladesh were likely instigated by a foreign intelligence agency, specifically suspecting the involvement of the ISI.
summary: Sajeeb Wazed Joy, son of former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, has claimed that the recent protests in Bangladesh were likely instigated by a foreign intelligence agency, specifically suspecting the involvement of the ISI.

title: Bangladesh Student Leader Who Led Protest Wants Sheikh Hasina To Face Trial
content: A Bangladeshi student leader who was instrumental in overthrowing Sheikh Hasina and is now part of an interim government said she must face trial when she returns home as planned for the killings during her term.
summary: A Bangladeshi student leader who was instrumental in overthrowing Sheikh Hasina and is now part of an interim government said she must face trial when she returns home as planned for the killings during her term.

title: US Announces $125 Million In New Military Aid For Ukraine
content: The United States on Friday announced $125 million in new military aid for Kyiv, as Ukrainian forces push ahead with a surprise offensive inside Russian territory.
summary: The United States on Friday announced $125 million in new military aid for Kyiv, as Ukrainian forces push ahead with a surprise offensive inside Russian territory.

title: Muhammad Yunus To Oversee 27 Ministries In Bangladesh's Interim Government
content: Bangladesh's interim leader Muhammad Yunus on Friday announced the portfolios of the newly-appointed council of advisors and took charge of 27 ministries, including defence.
summary: Bangladesh's interim leader Muhammad Yunus on Friday announced the portfolios of the newly-appointed council of advisors and took charge of 27 ministries, including defence.

title: Indian Embassy In Japan Issues Advisory After Experts Warn Of 'Megaquake'
content: The Indian Embassy in Japan issued a mega-quake advisory for Indian citizens residing in Japan on Friday, urging them to prepare for natural disasters after a strong magnitude 7.1 earthquake occurred on Thursday.
summary: The Indian Embassy in Japan issued a mega-quake advisory for Indian citizens residing in Japan on Friday, urging them to prepare for natural disasters after a strong magnitude 7.1 earthquake occurred on Thursday.
